intro: Turpinia glabra, commonly known as the smooth turpentine tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits. Turpinia glabra is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
